title: Call of Duty
notes: Game crashes with a "Buffer Overrun" error

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX Vega (VEGA10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.6-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: add MESA_EXTENSION_MAX_YEAR=2008 to launch options to fix buffer overflow error.
title: Call of Duty®

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX Vega (VEGA10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.10-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 6.0.1)
notes: Game runs after adding MESA_EXTENSION_MAX_YEAR=2008 %command% to the Steam game launch options. Main menu is a buggy mess and does not display correctly, it's best to make graphics tweaks and load save games from within the in-game menu which does display correctly. Game does not look.. right, has something to do with the game boosting the contrast on Windows which does not appear to be working through Proton. Peformance wise the game runs great, it has a few minor hiccups and that is it. But besides all that the game is perfectly playable, I played through about 1/3th of it (up to the dam level) without any issues.
title: Call of Duty®

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) Haswell Mobile x86/MMX/SSE2
notes: After adding MESA_EXTENSION_MAX_YEAR=2008 DRI_PRIME=1 %command% to the Steam game launch options the game runs flawless.
title: Call of Duty®

cpu: AMD Ryzen 5 2400G with Radeon Vega Graphics
notes:
it starts with "MESA_EXTENSION_MAX_YEAR=2008 DRI_PRIME=1 %command%" start commands, but has multiple problems running.

In fullscreen mode it is too dark and the brightness cannot be setup, the main menu has screwed rendering in fullscreen mode, and vsync results in stuttered rendering of the game.

All this can be avoided by playing in windowed mode, deactivating vsync and using this console command (console has to be activated in settings first): "/com_maxfps 60".

this can also be a very helpful command: "/cg_drawfps 1"
title: Call of Duty®
